page.title: 02Transport
page.content: Saxmundham is bi-sected by the A12 trunk road,although it is very shortly to be by-passed on its western side. The town was on the former Great Yarmouth to Ipswich Mail Coach run. The coaches stopped at the Bell Hotel 4 times a day, 2 times travelling to Yarmouth and 2 times to Ipswich. The Eastern Counties Omnibus Company has a bus station in the town and runs about 18 buses out of Saxmundham to Ipswich and a similar number from Saxmundham via the local villages to Leiston and Aldeburgh. There are 4 taxi services operating in the town. Out of 82 families interviewed 69 had a car and of them 14 families had 2 cars.
